content: slip_stitch to first single_crochet round 16 b ch1 turn sc18 join with slip_stitch to first single_crochet finish sleeves for long-sleeved version - numbering for the sleeves starts over at round 1 round 1 attach mc at ch2 space ch1 single_crochet in same space sc11 including next ch2 space join with slip_stitch to first single_crochet 12 scs round 2 ch1 turn single_crochet around join with slip_stitch to first single_crochet round 3 ch1 turn single_crochet around join with slip_stitch to first single_crochet finish off repeat for second sleeve there will be a little hole under the arms when you are weaving in the starting threads stitch the holes closed optional sword belt do surface slip_stitch at or below the color change for the pants until you get to where you want the opening for the sword to be cut your thread leaving 16 this is more than the bare minimum you need but allows for plenty to wrap around your fingers pull the thread to the front and ch3 skip 2 sts pull the thread to the back and continue with the surface slip_stitch to the other edge finish off here is a surface slip_stitch tutorial if you don t have this in your repertoire https //www supergurumi com/crochet-surface-slip-stitches finishing button loop at the neck chain 4 slip_stitch 1/4 down weave in all ends sew on a small button to close the back © dawn smith 9/30/23 2
